result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott E Szerlong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders, Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders, Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit 1,699 days for Counts 1 & 2.
Credit 1,701 days for Counts 3 thru 18.
Credit 226 days from Dismissed Read-In case 12CM270.
*Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 7 years of his sentence (for all counts sentenced on)
*NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program due to his age (for all counts sentenced on)
Concurrent with: with each other and all cases 12CF473, 14CF184, 14CF190, 15CF97, 15CF104 before this court

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution for the read-in files: 
14PT377 - $936.01 to Central Wisconsin Credit Union, joint and several with Clemons and Oseman.
14PT2342 - $1,733.29 to Central City Credit Union, joint and several with Clemons and Oseman.

Defendant is required to authorize the department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account to be used for payment of obligations in reasonable amounts as determined by DOC. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
*DNA surcharges not ordered by the Court.
*Child pornography surcharge to be determined.
*05-17-18 Order - $500 surcharge added to each Count 1 through 18 /s/TTF 05-17-18.

Submit a DNA sample. 
If he does not receive treatment while confined, he is to have an AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Otherwise be in full compliance with substance abuse aftercare treatment program in the community. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.
All prescriptions from the same pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases so DOC can monitor compliance. 
Pay restitution as stated above. 
DOC can take a reasonable amount for any new monies deposited in his prison account for restitution first, then costs and the balance due while on extended supervision.
Not have any use of computer or electronic devices with internet connection without prior agent approval.
Not have any contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior agent approval.
Complete psychosexual evaluation and comply with any treatment recommendations if there are any. 
Register as a sex offender pursuant to statute and administrative code.  Court does not order lifetime supervision.

E-Mail Correspondence from the Appeals Court in re:  Dismissal of Cases in Appeal "The action taken in the Circuit Court regarding this issue will have NO legal effect on any of the appeals in the Appellate Court"
   Clerk had also been informed from the Appellate Court that defendant would need to get in contact with his Attorney of Record, Lane Fitzgerald, to proceed in the Appellate Court.
Clerk left voice messag for Atty Lane Fitzgerald on 01/17/20 at 2:40 p.m. in re:  his client, the defendant, is asking that these appeals be dismissed

Defendant Scott E Szerlong appeared by phone. 
Cases heard at this time are 14CF-184, 12CF-473, 15CF-97, 14CF-190 and 15CF-104.

9:32 AM Court calls cases.
All the files are closed.
Prosecutor is not present. Atty Molepske indicated that he was not going to appear today.
Court states appearances.

Defendant is currently incarcerated at Oshkosh Correctional.

This is going on the record in response to a letter received by Defendant, indicating that for some reason CCAP records are indicating that his 5 files are still in appeal status, or at least that is what the CCAP records are indicating.
Court reads the last order from the Court of Appeals regarding these files. 

9:35 AM Atty Molepske has now appeared.

Defendant adresses the Court regarding the cases further, explained to the Court of Appeals that he did not want to proceed pro se. Defendant states the notices are causing him problems, for reasons stated.

Defendant has no intention of proceeding to appealing the cases. 

Atty Molepske addresses the Court, did not receive any additional paperwork on this. 

BY THE COURT:
Court will, based on Defendant's statement, on the record today, that he has no intention to appeal the no merit report filed in these files, that all appeals are hereby dismissed. 

Clerk to notify Becca regarding the dismissal of appeals

Becca Mohnen -PRC Administrator
Phone: 920-231-4010

Motion to Extend Time for Filing of Post Conviction Motion filed by Atty Lane Fitzgerald

Defendant Scott E Szerlong appeared by phone from Oshkosh Correctional. District Attorney (DA) Louis John Molepske appeared for State of Wisconsin. 

10:37 am  Court calls the case and states the appearances. 
Cases heard are 14CF184, 14CF190, 15CF97, and 15CF104. 
This is a contination of a hearing which Defendant asked for a review hearing regarding the Earned Release Program. 

Court summarizes the matter on the record. 
Based on the transcript, there never was a final statement from the State whether they were objecting to the issue. 
At the last hearing, DA Molepske believed that Defendant should not be eligible. 
Court indicated he re-read the Pre-Sentencing Report. 

Court asks Defendant if he wanted to make any statements before giving his decision. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court re: losing 200 days of credit and now not eligible for the Earned Release Program until March. 
DA Molepske makes arguments to the Court re: two factors for the program - if statutorily eligible and by the Court's discretion in checking the box. 
DA Molepske also makes statements to the Court re: the credit issue. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court is going to amend the Judgment of Conviction.  On page 6 of 8, the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program due to age, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 7 years.  Court indicates the Defendant should be given an incentive for reasons stated on the record.  
Court orders the Judgment of Conviction to be amended as indicated. 
Amended Judgment of Conviction will be sent to the prison.
Decision on September 6, 2018 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Scott Szerlong appeared by phone. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF184, 14CF190, 15CF97, 15CF104
8:25 a.m.   Court calls the case. 

Court is not prepared to give a decision today and will need to continue the matter for another day.  The court apologizes to the parties.  Decision scheduled for September 6, 2018 at 10:30 am.
IT IS ORDERED that the time to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is extended to September 30, 2018

ADDRESS INFO for Scott E Szerlong #499257
Current: PO Box 3310, c/o Oshkosh Correctional-#499257, Oshkosh, WI 54903 United States  (Effective: 08-29-2016)
Prior: PO Box 3310, c/o Oshkosh Correctional, Oshkosh, WI 54903 United States
Motion to Extend Time for Filing of Post Conviction Motion filed by Atty Lane Fitzgerald
Hearing on August 21, 2018 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Scott E Szerlong #499257 appeared by phone. No appearance by the State of Wisconsin.
8:36 a.m. Court calls the cases and states the appearances.
Cases heard today are 14CF184, 14CF190, 15CF97 & 15CF104.
Court questions Mr. Szerlong regarding his location.
Mr. Szerlong states he is in Oshkosh Correctional.
Court reviews the file. Matter is set for a sentence review hearing regarding Earned Release Program.

8:41 a.m. Ms. Stutesman, from the Portage County District Attorney's (DA's)  office appears in court. Ms. Stutesman states matter was not put on DA's Calendar and Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Ryan Wetzsteon to appear on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.
Court continues to review the transcript and questions Mr. Szerlong, who is appearing Pro Se for this hearing.
Mr. Szerlong responds.

8:44 a.m. ADA  Wetzsteon appears on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews the matter for the record for the ADA.
ADA Wetzsteon makes statements to the court regarding the State's position on the Earned Released Program.
Mr. Szerlong makes statements regarding his position on his eligibility for the Earned Release Program.
Court questions Mr. Szerlong.
Mr. Szerlong responds.
Court reviews the sentencing transcript for the record.
ADA Wetzsteon makes statements to the Court regarding State's position on eligibility for the Earned Release Program.

8:55 a.m. DA Louis Molepske now appears in Court for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews the matter for the record for the DA.
ADA Wetzsteon leaves the courtroom.
DA Molepske makes statements to the court regarding the State's position on the Earned Released Program.
Mr. Szerlong responds.
8:55 a.m. DA Louis Molepske is now present in Court for the State of Wisconsin.

BY THE COURT:
Court will take time to review the PSI. Matter to be adjourned. 
Mr. Szerlong to appear by phone. Matter to set for 2 weeks.
Letter from the defendant dated 05/31/18 in re:  eligibility for he Earned Release Program
Sentence adjustment review on July 24, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Child Pornography Surcharge Applicability filed by the State
Letter from Northcentral Tech dated 11/01/16
Letter from DA's Office dated 11/22/17

Defendant Scott E Szerlong in court with attorney Brian William Severson. Defendant Scott E Szerlong in custody. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 12CF473, 14CF184, 14CF190, 15CF97, 15CF104
10:07 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Court and Atty Molepske have received the PSI. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Atty Molepske states one correction to the PSI. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Atty Severson has received the PSI and reviewed it with his client.  States factual corrections. 
Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Severson makes sentencing arguments to the Court.  
Court questions Probation Agent Voss. 
Atty Molepske makes statements to correct prior statement. 
Atty Severson makes additional statements. 
Atty Molepske makes additional statements. 

Atty Severson continues with sentencing arguments. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Court makes statements re: Earned Release and Challenge Incarceration eligibility statutes. 
Atty Severson makes statements to the Court.  Statutorily these are available but DOC has it's own program requirements.  It is his understanding they will not find him eligible for the child pornography charge.
Atty Molepske makes statements.  Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration due to his age. 
Court questions agent Voss. 
Agent Voss makes statements.  Agress with statements by Atty Severson. 
Court questions counsel re: sentence credit. 
Atty Severson indicates there is 226 days credit for 12CM270 which was dismissed and read-in.  An additional 1,696 days on the child pornography case.  
Atty Molepske agrees with the 1,696 days credit. 
Court questions Atty Severson re: signature bonds. 
Atty Severson does agree with the signature bonds.  Makes arguments re: credit on the dismissed and read-in cases. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
12CF473 Count 2 - 
4 years prison with 2 years initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision. 
Pay restitution of $1,044.00 to Associated Bank as a condition of extended supervision.

14CF190 Count 2 - 
4 years prison with 2 years initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision, concurrent. 
Pay restitution of $229.82 to Fleet Farm as a condition of extended supervision.

15CF97 Count 1 - 
6 years prison with 3 years initial confinement followed by 3 years extended supervision, concurrent to all cases. 
Pay restitution of:
$100.57 to Trigs. 
$243.36 to Trigs, joint and several with Charles Davis. 
$157.83 to Cooper Oil. 
$175.26 to Cooper Oil, joint and several with Charles Davis. 

15CF97 Count 2 - 
6 years prison with 3 years initial confinement followed by 3 years extended supervision, concurrent to all cases. 

15CF104 Count 1 - 
6 years prison with 3 years initial confinement followed by 3 years extended supervision, concurrent to all cases. 

15CF104 Count 2 - 
6 years prison with 3 years initial confinement followed by 3 years extended supervision, concurrent to all cases. 

14CF184 Counts 1 thru 4:  
On each count - 
18 years prison with 9 years initial confinement followed by 9 years extended supervision, concurrent with one another and to all cases before this court.
Not eligible for Earned Release or Challenge Incarceration Programs.

14CF184 Counts 5 thru 18: 
On each count - 
15 years prison with 9 years initial confinement followed by 6 years extended supervision, concurrent to all counts.
 
Total credit 1,922 days.

Court addresses mandatory $500 pornography surcharge on each count. 
Atty Severson makes arguments to the Court, believes that was passed after this case.  
Atty Molepske makes arguments to the Court, believes that it is at the time of sentencing. 
Court questions Atty Severson. 
BY THE COURT:  Court asks parties to send a memorandum, less than 1 page, re: why or why not the court should order the pornography surcharge. 

Court reviews DNA surcharge statute. 
Atty Severson makes arguments to the Court re: DNA surcharge.  Asks that it not be ordered. 
Court questions Atty Severson re: when DNA was submitted. 
Atty Severson responds.  
BY THE COURT:  Court does not order the DNA surcharge for reasons stated on the record. 
Court questions Agent Voss.  
Agent Voss responds.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision: 
On each count: 
Pay costs.  
Submit a DNA sample. 
If he does not received treatment while confined, he is to have an AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Otherwise be in full compliance with substance abuse aftercare treatment program in the community. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.
All prescriptions from the same pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases so DOC can monitor compliance. 
Pay restitution as stated above. 
DOC can take a reasonable amount for any new monies deposited in his prison account for restitution first, then costs and the balance due while on extended supervision.
Not have any use of computer or electronic devices with internet connection without prior agent approval.
Not have any contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior agent approval.
Complete psychosexual evaluation and comply with any treatment recommendations if there are any. 
Pay restitution for the read-in files: 
14PT377 - $936.01 to Central Wisconsin Credit Union, joint and several with Clemons and Oseman.
14PT2342 - $1,733.29 to Central City Credit Union, joint and several with Clemons and Oseman.

Both parties retain their PSI's confidentially in their files. 

Atty Molepske makes statements re: lifetime supervision.
BY THE COURT:  Court does not order lifetime supervision in this case. 
20 days to appeal. 

Atty Severson makes statements re: sex offender registration. 

BY THE COURT:  Register as a sex offender pursuant to statute and administrative code.  Court does not order lifetime supervision.

Defendant Andrea R. Oseman appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Louis J. Molepske appeared for State of Wisconsin.

1:16 PM Court calls cases.

Court suggests the DA's office that when there is a warrant appearance, that the DA's office should notify the attorney of record.

1:17 PM Atty Kryshak appears at this time.

Atty Molepske has not had a chance to discuss this with Atty Kryshak, was only notified of this this mid morning.

Atty Molepske addresses 14CF-184, subject warrant.

Atty Kryshak did not know that his client was at the jail.

Atty Kryshak does not know why his client did not appear.

Court questions Defendant as to her non appearance at the initial appearance in  14CF-405.

Defendant addresses the Court, was homeless, did not have a stable place. Defendant has somewhere to live now, more stable.

Court questions her non appearances in 14CM-499 and 14CM-485. 

Defendant replies, has been homeless since April.

Notice was sent out in March.  Defendant does not know where that notice went.

Court continues questioning.
Defendant replies.

BY THE COURT:
Court will quash the warrants.

State addresses bond, requests cash bond with conditions.

Atty Kryshak requests signature bond.

Atty Molepske addresses the status of 14CF-184.

Court finds Defendant previously failed to appear. Defendant was given notice of the plea hearing for May 8th at 8:30 which she failed to appear.  Defendant failed to appear when ordered by Branch 3 for a suppression motion.

Atty Molepske has prepared the order for 14CF-184 in order to quash the warrant and transferred to the Sheriff - so material witness warrant is quashed.

$200 Cash Bond Set - Comply with all properly served subpoenas.
